intro: Leucheria coquimbana, commonly known as the Coquimbo leucheria, is a flowering plant native to Chile. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas, thriving in sandy or rocky soils. Its leaves are narrow and opposite, and it produces capsule fruits that contain minute seeds. Leucheria coquimbana is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting well to coastal climates.
